Directives > ui-accordion

Markup

Markup in your HTML template 

<ui-accordion>
    <ui-accordion-pane>
      <ui-accordion-pane-header>[content]</ui-accordion-pane-header>
      <ui-accordion-pane-content>[content]</ui-accordion-pane-content>
    </ui-accordion-pane>
</ui-accordion>

Allows multiples sections open at once
{{ pane.header }}
{{section.section}}
 

<ui-accordion allow-multiple control="accordionControl">
    <ui-accordion-pane ng-repeat="pane in panes" expanded="$first">
        <ui-accordion-pane-header>
            <h5>{{ pane.header }}</h5>
        </ui-accordion-pane-header>
        <ui-accordion-pane-content>
            <div class="ui-accordion-content-entry" ng-repeat="section in pane.content">{{section.section}}</div>
        </ui-accordion-pane-content>
    </ui-accordion-pane>
</ui-accordion>

Callback
Toggle first pane Expand all Collapse all Collapse the first Add element Update Pane Add pane 

$scope.accordionControl = {
  onExpand: function (expandedPaneIndex) {
    console.log('expanded:', expandedPaneIndex);
  },
  onCollapse: function (collapsedPaneIndex) {
    console.log('collapsed:', collapsedPaneIndex);
  },
  addElt: function() {
    $scope.panes[0].content.unshift({
      section: 'autocomplete'
    });
  },
  addPane: function() {
    $scope.panes.unshift({
      header: 'NEW PANE',
      content: [{
        section: 'New element'
      }]        
    });
  }
};

ui-accordion Options

Name type description
ui-accordion expression Expression that should be used to set up an accordion.
allow-multiple string To allow multiple sections open at once.

ui-accordion-pane Options

Name type description
ui-accordion-pane expression Expression that should be used to set up an accordion pane.
expanded string The pane to be automaticaly opened when accordion is instantiate.
Can use ngRepeat properties like $first see ngRepeat doc
